GF#13132 says: "Details (Edit)
The orange we use to flag what version you're looking at is ugly and hard to read. The blue on red banner at the bottom is even worse. The yellow side-menus (in the few places they appear - could we make that consistent?) are pretty ugly too." (I could tell it was Lloyd before I looked...)
does anyone have any opinions on this?

General comment: IMHO a beautiful technology like FHIR also deserves a beautiful website. There's definitely room for improvement. Let's not underestimate the importance of design. People do judge a book on it's cover.
And It's crucial to recognize that developers are not designers. UI/UX design is a specialization. Also, I've learned from experience that asking users for design input is not always helpful - degustibus not disputandum.
